intro: Senecio magnicaliculatus, commonly known as the grandiflorus groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. It produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
